definitions: ride a bicycle with the pedals at rest, especially downhill

examples.text: he had come freewheeling down the road

shortDefinitions: ride bicycle with pedals at rest

definitions: allow a motor vehicle to travel without the engine running or in neutral gear

examples.text: she was convinced that she saved a lot of money by turning the engine off and freewheeling down the hill

shortDefinitions: drive motor vehicle without engaging clutch

definitions: act or proceed in a relaxed or casual way, without making much effort

examples.text: I'm not the sort of person who would freewheel his way to the end of a contract
another manager might have been willing to freewheel through one final season

shortDefinitions: act or proceed in a relaxed or casual way

definitions: a device that allows a bicycle wheel to revolve forward while the crank is stationary.
shortDefinitions: bicycle wheel which is able to revolve freely when no power is being applied to pedals

definitions: a device in a motor vehicle transmission allowing the drive shaft to spin faster than the engine.
shortDefinitions: device in motor vehicle transmission allowing drive shaft
